body.description: Goodnites is the #1 Nighttime Underwear* for bedwetting and helps your kids wake up feeling awesome. Goodnites Overnight Bedwetting Underwear for Boys provide 35% less leaks** and holds up to 3 water bottles***. Goodnites Bedwetting Underwear offers our best fit and protection guaranteed**** for kids ages 3 and up. These disposable bedwetting pants are made with 5 Layer Protection and reinforced Double Leg Barriers. As our most comfortable nighttime protection, our overnight bedwetting pants feature super stretchy sides to fit many body shapes and sizes. Unlike training pants, Goodnites disposable bedwetting underwear discreetly absorb odor and offer 40% more protection vs. the leading training pant. Plus, our nighttime bedwetting pants are clinically proven to be hypoallergenic and are free of added fragrances, parabens and elemental chlorine bleaching. Coming in Marvel superhero designs, Goodnites Boys' Bedwetting Underwear offer more sizes for a comfortable, tailored fit up to 140+ lbs and are available in Size XS (28-43 lbs), S/M (43-68 lbs), L (68-95 lbs) and XL (95-140+ lbs). FSA/HSA-eligible in the US. (*Youth Pant category share data) (**Boys Large vs. other national brand) (***three 8 fl oz water bottles, 24 fl oz in total. Applicable for Boy L and Boy XL only) (****If you're not completely satisfied with the fit of your Goodnites Underwear, we can help. Original receipt/UPC required. Restrictions apply. See Goodnites website for details. Purchase by 12/31/2023. Mail in within 30 days of purchase, no later than 02/28/2024)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Previous page Stay Dry Goodnites offer outstanding nighttime protection. It’s No Big Deal 1 in 6 kids aged 3-12 experience nocturnal enuresis; that’s 7 million kids in the U.S. alone. It Just Takes Time Nighttime wetting goes away with time, Goodnites is here to help kids wake up dry in the meantime. Bedwetting Happens If your child is dry during the day buy still wet at night, then it’s time to switch to Goodnites! Listening is Key Your child will have questions, and we’re here with answers. Check out our article section online! Next page 1 Stay Dry 2 It’s No Big Deal 3 It Just Takes Time 4 Bedwetting Happens 5 Listening is Key

What is bedwetting? Bedwetting is caused by delayed development in communication between the brain & bladder while a child is asleep. It typically goes away in time, as hormone levels adjust & the bladder grows. What are Goodnites? Goodnites are disposable nighttime underwear specifically designed to fit & provide protection for children who only wet at night. Goodnites even come in an XS size for children who are potty trained, but still experiencing nighttime wetness. Should you talk to your doctor about bedwetting? Yes, it’s important to speak with your child’s doctor & figure out the best management program for your family. Be sure to include your child, too. When kids hear they’re not alone, it instills confidence & understanding about the condition. Why should I choose Goodnites Nighttime Underwear instead of training pants? While Pull-Ups are ideal for potty training, Goodnites are best for nighttime protection. Our small sizes provide a better fit and offer 40% more protection that the leading training pants, so even when lying down kids are less likely to leak. What advice do you have for parents? Trust yourself and don’t put too much pressure on how you think it’s supposed to go. Every child is different. If your little one is still wet at night, just know you are not alone and it’s nothing to be embarrassed about - they will grow out of it!

Explore All Three Goodnites Products Goodnites Nighttime Underwear Goodnites Disposable Bed Mats Goodnites Nighttime Underwear Absorbency Maximum – 40% more protection than the leading training pant Absorbency Maximum – The same super absorbent technology as Goodnites Nighttime Underwear Absorbency Maximum – 40% more protection than the leading training pant Protection 5 layer protection and double leg barriers to help eliminate leaks Protection Micro-Pocket Technology, super-absorbent core, & stay-in-place adhesive Protection 5 layer protection and double leg barriers to help eliminate leaks Discretion Disposable absorbent pant with a stretchy waistband for soft, underwear-like fit Discretion Disposable absorbent bed mat with soft, quiet material & placed on top of sheet Discretion Disposable absorbent pant with a stretchy waistband for soft, underwear-like fit Size and Fit Available in XS (28-43 lbs), S/M (43-68 lbs), L (68-95 lbs), XL (95-140+ lbs) Size and Fit One size (30 in x 36 in) to fit across twin-size bed Size and Fit Available in XS (28-43 lbs), S/M (43-68 lbs), L (68-95 lbs), XL (95-140+ lbs) Design Fun and modern prints your child will love wearing to bed Design White Design Fun and modern prints your child will love wearing to bed

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding alternative to diapers for autistic children
reviews.reviewText: I have 2 autistic children that have been quite hard to potty train. They are now 9 years old, and I finally got one trained, but the other still needs to wear something. Well since he is 9 years old, regular diapers won’t fit him, and he’s still too small to wear adult diapers, so these perfectly fit the bill! They are on the pricey side compared to diapers, but they are WELL worth it. These have soft stretchy sides that do not tear easily… there are no diaper tabs to come loose… they fit basically like underwear. But they are SUPER absorbent and have yet to leak in all the years I’ve been using them. There’s no gross plastic covering either like diapers, they are very breathable. Also another thing to mention, they don’t have those weird strings in them that are inside regular diapers. Autistic boys like to constantly rub themselves for some reason, and it causes diapers to break down and some kind of stringy things get wrapped around their genitals and it seems very dangerous. But that is NOT a problem with these. These just have soft cotton inside.I absolutely LOVE the new sizing of these as well. One of my twins is very overweight for his age, and the new XL size came out just in time to meet his needs until I got him trained. These can be worn under clothes and they’re not big and bulky at all. Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My grandson has a need for these and he is a mover and a shaker. He’s a larger boy and these keep him clean and dry while we are still potty training. These are comfortable and don’t cut into his thighs. They are easy to get up and down and rip on the sides. The price point here on prime is better than local as i regularly price compare. If the price is cheaper elsewhere I’ll go there. This far, prime is on point and that’s where I’ll order. Thanks prime.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Our Go To
reviews.reviewText: These are our go to night time underpants. They work really well and they don’t leak unless overfilled. I wish more came in the packages for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Leak-proof if I add a booster pad! Great fit 👍🏼
reviews.reviewText: My son is 3 & still in diapers, but *almost* ready to potty train. He outgrew his trusty size 6 Hello Bello Night diapers, but nothing I tried seemed to compare. We tried Ninjamas first; I loved the softness, fit, and how high up they went. Unfortunately, he pees right out the side of them. I’ve gotten Good Nights before and love how they fit, but hated them because he always leaked! Turns out, all we needed was a good booster pad.He’s 34 lbs and wears 3t & some 4T clothing. The XS is actually a little big in his waist, but it still works. Adding a good booster pad helps it fit better. For some reason I ordered size Small last time, and they ALSO worked with a pad. I even put these on him for long car rides and naps, and so far he hasn’t had any accidents.They’re not as soft as other diapers, but they’re not as scratchy or rough as Pull-Ups brand. They fit like underwear and are easy enough for him to pull on and off himself. Occasionally I rip one while pulling it on, but it’s not as often as Pull-Ups brand.Get these and the Good Nights booster pad inserts!! For extra protection at night, I use Super Sposies. Both work great but the Good Nights pads fit these perfectly.Hope this helps ☺️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These are great night time pants and have been keeping our kids sheets dry. Very helpful for kids with developmental delays. I think goodnites is looking at doing a larger size as well, which would be great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A Blessing for Daytime Use, But Nighttime Challenges
reviews.reviewText: We are incredibly grateful for the availability of the extra larger size in Goodnites, as it has allowed our son to continue using these convenient products rather than moving on to larger, bulkier adult options. The absorbency and standing gathers in these underwear have been effective in managing his high urine output during the day and preventing leaks between cathing.However, we have faced occasional nighttime leaks, requiring us to change him before we go to bed or switch to a more absorbent product for the night. One notable drawback is the difficulty of removing these for catheterization or changing when on the go, and they can tear when seated in a wheelchair. We've found that with Pull-Ups or briefs, we can open and fold them down when using adaptive side-zipping pants, which is a more accessible option.It would be a welcome improvement if Goodnites could incorporate hoot-and-loop sides, similar to Pull-Ups, to address these challenges. This adjustment would not only make catheterization and changing more manageable but also eliminate the need to remove shoes and pants, streamlining the process for caregivers and users alike.
